cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone / below hurricane scale
cyclone.current_location: about 475 mi (765 km) south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north across the west-central Gulf of Mexico, expected to turn slightly northeast and make landfall along the central Louisiana coast before continuing inland toward Mississippi/Alabama

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in Texas – warnings begin east of Intracoastal City, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Intracoastal City, LA, eastward to the Alabama/Florida border including Lakes Pontchartrain and Maurepas and metro New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast (LA–MS–AL) and adjacent inland areas
weather_observation.first_hazard: Arrival of tropical storm-force winds (eastern Gulf Coast – not expected at Port Freeport)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible; sustained tropical-storm winds not expected at Port Freeport (probabilities <10%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the Upper Texas Coast; surge focus is east of TX–LA line
weather_observation.rainfall: Occasional showers, but heavy core rainfall expected well east of the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and rip currents on the Upper Texas Coast through Friday
